summary: when dr strange had a huge role in iw after only one solo movie and a small cameo nobody complained. same went for tchalla and...
body: when dr strange had a huge role in iw after only one solo movie and a small cameo nobody complained. same went for tchalla and peter. now carol is getting her own solo then she’s going to appear in endgame. tell me why only in her case ppl are mad she’s “popping out of nowhere”

summary:
Decided to take these in anticipation of the upcoming Captain Marvel movie!
“Good is not a thing not a thing you are, it’s a...
body:
Decided to take these in anticipation of the upcoming Captain Marvel movie!

“Good is not a thing not a thing you are, it’s a thing you do”

My sister has always been a bookworm, and I’m hoping after this shoot I inspired her to pick up some comics too. Especially since there are so many wonderful heroes for her to look up to. I’ll definitely be taking more photos like this!

Side note-idk who the original artist are for the comic art so if you know please let me know so I can credit them!

blog.name: captainmarvelthekree
blog.title: Captain Marvel the Kree
blog.description: Tribute blog to Marvel's (Kree) Captains Marvel: Mar-Vell, Genis-Vell, Carol Danvers, Phyla-Vell, Noh-Varr and associates (so, also Guardians of the Galaxy, Rick Jones, Thanos, Adam Warlock, Quasar, The Avengers and Cosmic Stuff in general, Hulkling and the Young Avengers, etc).

blog.name: agentofassgard
blog.title: My supersonic ship's at your disposal if you feel so inclined.
blog.description: Nobody has to be hip; nobody needs to be out of sight.

tags: maybe we can make a bingo card out of this
body:
Endgame: The End

Thanos’ arm is wicked damaged at the end of Infinity War. He didnt plan to do the snap so soon, but Thor drove him to it. The gauntlet is also damaged. Thanos probably knows the remaining Avengers are going to come after him, so he needs another one pronto.

Tony goes back in time with the help of Ant-Man. First, to New York when the Chitauri came. It makes the most sense for him to interrogate Loki after the carnage is over because everyone is already together. Loki almost certainly knows where the Mind Stone was before Thanos had it to put it in the scepter. Maybe Tony gets stuck in space because something goes hinky during his time traveling back. He gets rescued by Captain Marvel. There is an end credits scene during the CM movie that will drop just a juicy enough morsel about Endgame (probably her saving Tony) to work people into a shitstorm for that last month.

In the meantime, in the modern day, Thor goes to Jotunheim to ask for help in assembling an army. He gets told that he will need to speak with their new king. It is Loki, in full Jotun form, and God damn it if we dont get some kind of fucking hug between them at this point I might die. Loki made a deal with Hela during his few moments off screen in IW before he died. Maybe he gets a nice scene with Frigga the way Thor did with Odin in Ragnarok. Heimdall is probably also involved.

Everyone collaborates and travels around in time to collect the other Stones, and then goes back together even further to where the Mind Stone is. Maybe the Guardians sacrifice something to get the Soul Stone. There’s a confrontation, Thanos against the original six Avengers. Then Doctor Strange interrupts at a pivotal moment, followed by Wong if hes still around, Scarlet Witch, and then Loki. Theres a lot of eye fucking between Loki and Thanos, because holy tits, look who’s back bitch. Loki probably looks Aesir again and green seidr crackles at his fingertips, Thor’s with blue lightning. Then they really get to work.

Bruce has the Mind Stone. Maybe he has to reconcile with Hulk to obtain it, and honestly what else are seven PhDs good for? I sincerely hope Thor asks him that. Maybe the Wakandans help create something that will allow humans to hold the Stones. Maybe Selvig and Jane (and Darcy!) will come back.

Steve, the Man Out of Time, holds the Time Stone, naturally. Nat, with her logical red ledger in place, soberingly takes Reality. Clint takes the Space Stone because he was controlled by it. Thor takes the Power Stone, enough said. Tony, the soul of the team, takes the sixth and final stone.

Maybe the combined stones bring about the Ego Stone from the comics with the help and shielding of the sorcerers. Loki will be positioned in the corner near Thor, Strange by the Time Stone, Wanda near the Mind Stone, and Wong near reality or some such. Maybe Thanos takes the Ego Stone, intending to control it, but he’s no match for all of them combined at last. This is the endgame that Strange saw, then: Thanos snaps, confident of his ability to play God (but never to actually be one, as Loki told him), but it brings the people from the first snap back instead of the second mass extermination he prepared for. Or he snaps and it destroys him, and then the other six stones revive everyone. Maybe Hela claims his soul. She still thinks Loki is a little shit.

The mid credits scene is everyone eating shawarma. Stan Lee is the restaurant owner or something and quips about them loitering for so long.

The post credits scene is the Grandmaster, doing whatever the fuck he wants.

blog.name: giveamadeuschohisownmovie
blog.title: Just some Filipino guy trying to sort his life out
blog.description: Steven Yeun should be Nightwing. That is all.

title: MCU Shang-Chi movie fancast
body:
Been wanting to make this, especially considering my username. So…here we go.

1) Tiger Chen as Shang-Chi (going with a lesser-known actor, give him the MCU boost)

2) Yuen Wah as Zheng Zu, Shang-Chi’s father and the main antagonist of the movie. In this version, he is a powerful mobster that rules over the criminal undergrounds all over East Asia and Southeast Asia (so…Kingpin, but way more powerful). 

Also, he’s not referred to as “Fu Manchu” for obvious reasons.

3) Jiang Wen as Zheng Zu’s wise brother and Shang-Chi’s father figure. He gets the “tragic death at the hands of the villain, inspiring the main protagonist to rise up and take revenge”.

4) Jim Broadbent as Sir Denis Nayland Smith, Zheng Zu’s nemesis and the leader of the MI6 team investigating his activities. He ends up recruiting Shang-Chi when they realize their goals match.

5) Awkwafina as Fah Lo Suee, a spoiled, wealthy businesswoman and Zheng Zu’s daughter / Shang-Chi’s half-sister. She’s the secondary antagonist of the movie.

(with this description, I like to think she’s playing an evil version of her character from Crazy Rich Asians here) 

6) Henry Cavill as “Black” Jack Tarr, a MI6 agent who becomes Shang-Chi’s best friend / sidekick

7) Katie Leung as Leiko Wu, a former SHIELD agent who reluctantly works with MI6. She is Shang-Chi’s main love interest. 

8) Jimmy Akingbola as M’Nai / Midnight, a Wakandan exile who was adopted and raised by Zheng Zu as Shang-Chi and Fah Lo Suee’s brother.

9) Iko Uwais as Shen Kuei / The Cat, a mercenary and Shang-Chi’s main rival / occasional ally. He’s not a villain but does have a rivalry with Shang-Chi over who is the better martial artist between them.

10) Yayan Ruhian, Brandon Vera, Julie Estelle, and Tsuyoshi Ihara as Zheng Zu’s lieutenants. They all have a badass fight scene with Shang-Chi and friends (think of them as “boss fights”). 

11) Ali Wong appears as one of Shang-Chi’s friends who tags along with him once he goes after Zheng Zu. Basically, the movie’s comic relief character.

12) Donnie Yen appears in the minor role of Tiger Claw, Zheng Zu’s closest lieutenant and the leader of the Si-Fan, an ancient secret society that controls all of Asia. He takes over Zheng Zu’s criminal empire after Zheng Zu’s defeat. 

His role is minor here because he’ll be the main villain of Shang-Chi 2. 

13) Brie Larson cameos as Carol Danvers / Captain Marvel in the post-credits scene, where she approaches Shang-Chi for a position in the New Avengers.

1) Tiger Chen as Shang-Chi (going with a lesser-known actor, give him the MCU boost)

2) Yuen Wah as Zheng Zu, Shang-Chi’s father and the main antagonist of the movie. In this version, he is a powerful mobster that rules over the criminal undergrounds all over East Asia and Southeast Asia (so…Kingpin, but way more powerful). 

Also, he’s not referred to as “Fu Manchu” for obvious reasons.

3) Jiang Wen as Zheng Zu’s wise brother and Shang-Chi’s father figure. He gets the “tragic death at the hands of the villain, inspiring the main protagonist to rise up and take revenge”.

4) Jim Broadbent as Sir Denis Nayland Smith, Zheng Zu’s nemesis and the leader of the MI6 team investigating his activities. He ends up recruiting Shang-Chi when they realize their goals match.

5) Awkwafina as Fah Lo Suee, a spoiled, wealthy businesswoman and Zheng Zu’s daughter / Shang-Chi’s half-sister. She’s the secondary antagonist of the movie.

(with this description, I like to think she’s playing an evil version of her character from Crazy Rich Asians here) 

6) Henry Cavill as “Black” Jack Tarr, a MI6 agent who becomes Shang-Chi’s best friend / sidekick

7) Katie Leung as Leiko Wu, a former SHIELD agent who reluctantly works with MI6. She is Shang-Chi’s main love interest. 

8) Jimmy Akingbola as M’Nai / Midnight, a Wakandan exile who was adopted and raised by Zheng Zu as Shang-Chi and Fah Lo Suee’s brother.

9) Iko Uwais as Shen Kuei / The Cat, a mercenary and Shang-Chi’s main rival / occasional ally. He’s not a villain but does have a rivalry with Shang-Chi over who is the better martial artist between them.

10) Yayan Ruhian, Brandon Vera, Julie Estelle, and Tsuyoshi Ihara as Zheng Zu’s lieutenants. They all have a badass fight scene with Shang-Chi and friends (think of them as “boss fights”). 

11) Ali Wong appears as one of Shang-Chi’s friends who tags along with him once he goes after Zheng Zu. Basically, the movie’s comic relief character.

12) Donnie Yen appears in the minor role of Tiger Claw, Zheng Zu’s closest lieutenant and the leader of the Si-Fan, an ancient secret society that controls all of Asia. He takes over Zheng Zu’s criminal empire after Zheng Zu’s defeat. 

His role is minor here because he’ll be the main villain of Shang-Chi 2. 

13) Brie Larson cameos as Carol Danvers / Captain Marvel in the post-credits scene, where she approaches Shang-Chi for a position in the New Avengers.
